context: In Estonian, 'ela' is an imperative form of the verb 'elama' (to live). It's often used as a well-wishing expression similar to 'cheers' or 'blessing' in English. When used as 'Elagu!', it functions as a toast meaning 'To your health!' or 'Cheers!'. The word carries connotations of wishing someone life, vitality, and good fortune.
